articles.description: Australia's Alexei Popyrin hands defending champion Novak Djokovic his earliest US Open defeat in 18 years with victory in the third round.
articles.title: Novak Djokovic out of US Open 2024: Defending champion loses to Alexei Popyrin

articles.description: BBC Sport looks at the biggest stories from the transfer window - including what happened on deadline day, the surprising big spenders and more.
articles.title: Transfer Deadline Day: Who spent and signed the most in summer window?

articles.description: Chelsea sign Manchester United winger Jadon Sancho on loan until the end of the season.
articles.title: Jadon Sancho: Chelsea sign Manchester United winger on loan

articles.description: Chelsea forward Raheem Sterling completes a late transfer deadline day loan move to Premier League rivals Arsenal.
articles.title: Raheem Sterling: Arsenal sign Chelsea forward on loan

articles.description: England’s Gus Atkinson says he is not surprised by his maiden century in the second Test against Sri Lanka at Lord’s.
articles.title: England vs Sri Lanka: Gus Atkinson not surprised by maiden century

articles.description: Brentford striker Ivan Toney signs for Saudi Pro League club Al-Ahli after the Bees had accepted a fee of around £40m.
articles.title: Ivan Toney: Saudi Pro League club Al-Ahli sign Brentford striker

articles.description: Manchester United complete the signing of midfielder Manuel Ugarte from Paris St-Germain in a deal that could reach £50.8m.
articles.title: Manuel Ugarte: Man Utd complete signing of Uruguay midfielder from PSG

articles.description: Arsenal striker Eddie Nketiah joins Crystal Palace for a fee in the region of £30m on transfer deadline day.
articles.title: Eddie Nketiah: Crystal Palace sign Arsenal striker for £30m on deadline day

articles.description: Napoli sign Manchester United's Scottish midfielder Scott McTominay for a fee of around £25.4m.
articles.title: Scott McTominay: Manchester United and Scotland midfielder joins Napoli

articles.description: Tully Kearney claims her second gold medal of the Paris Paralympics while Maisie Summers-Newton, Jaco van Gass and Lizzi Jordan also secure victories on an outstanding second day of action for Great Britain.
articles.title: Paris Paralympics 2024: Great Britain win four golds on day two
